alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chenango; Delaware; Otsego; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 11:33AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SULLIVAN...OTSEGO... CHENANGO...BROOME...DELAWARE...SOUTHERN WAYNE...SUSQUEHANNA... LACKAWANNA...PIKE...WYOMING...NORTHERN WAYNE...BRADFORD...AND LUZERNE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1133 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Caroga Lake to 6 miles west of Lovelton and moving northeast at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Rockland, Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Falls, Hazleton, Muhlenberg, Dunmore, Oneonta, Kingston and Fallsburg. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 1 and near 2 East. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 75 and 114. Interstate 88 between 5 and 19. Interstate 80 between 256 and 273. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 143 and 230. Interstate 84 between 1 and 53. Interstate 380 between 20 and 24. Interstate 476 between 105 and 131. SAFETY INFO... The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. &&
